<body lang=EN-US link=blue vlink=blue style='tab-interval:.5in'>

<div class=Section1>

<p class=MsoNormal><b>Fall 2009<o:p></o:p></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><b>CS 153-Logic Design Laboratory<o:p></o:p></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><b>Instructor: </b>Professor Eli Bozorgzadeh, Computer
Science Department<b><o:p></o:p></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><b>Lecture Hours / Location: </b>Mon-Wed-<span class=GramE>Fri
 2:00</span>-2:50 p.m. / DBH 1423 <b><o:p></o:p></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><b>Lab Hours / Location:</b> Mon-Wed 4:30-5:50 p.m. / ICS
192 (UCI Map: E6-Location #302)<b><o:p></o:p></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><b>Co-requisites: <o:p></o:p></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span class=GramE>ICS 151 or consent of the instructor.</span> 
Students should have familiarity with fundamentals of integrated circuit
blocks. </p>

<p class=MsoNormal><b>Course Grading:<o:p></o:p></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal>Projects (100%<span class=GramE>)-</span> demo (70%), report
(30%)</p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span class=GramE>submit</span> your report through <a
href="http://www.eee.uci.edu">EEE</a> tool.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal><b>Resources<o:p></o:p></b></p>

<ul style='margin-top:0in' type=disc>
 <li class=MsoNormal style='mso-list:l0 level1 lfo3;tab-stops:list .5in'><a
     href="http://givargis.ics.uci.edu/courses/cs153/resources/ModelSim.html"><span
     class=SpellE>ModelSim</span></a></li>
 <li class=MsoNormal style='mso-list:l0 level1 lfo3;tab-stops:list .5in'><a
     href="http://www.model.com/resources/student_edition/download.asp"><span
     class=SpellE>ModelSim</span> Student Edition</a> </li>
 <li class=MsoNormal style='mso-list:l0 level1 lfo3;tab-stops:list .5in'><a
     href="http://www.ics.uci.edu/%7Eeli/courses/cs153-w09/ashenden.pdf">P.J. <span
     class=SpellE>Ashenden</span>, <i>The VHDL Cookbook</i></a></li>
 <li class=MsoNormal style='mso-list:l0 level1 lfo3;tab-stops:list .5in'>"VHDL
     for Digital Design", by Frank <span class=SpellE>Vahid</span> and
     Roman <span class=SpellE>Lysecky</span>, <i>John Wiley and Sons Inc, </i>2006.</li>
</ul>

<p class=MsoNormal><b>Lecture Topics<o:p></o:p></b></p>

<ul style='margin-top:0in' type=disc>
 <li class=MsoNormal style='mso-list:l2 level1 lfo6;tab-stops:list .5in'><a
     href="http://www.ics.uci.edu/%7Eeli/courses/cs153-f09/VHDl-guide.doc">Introduction
     to VHDL </a></li>
 <li class=MsoNormal style='mso-list:l2 level1 lfo6;tab-stops:list .5in'>Combinational
     Circuits (<a
     href="http://www.ics.uci.edu/%7Eeli/courses/cs153-w09/divider.pdf">example</a>)</li>
 <li class=MsoNormal style='mso-list:l2 level1 lfo6;tab-stops:list .5in'><a
     href="http://www.ics.uci.edu/%7Eeli/courses/cs153-w09/lecture3.pdf">Sequential
     Circuits </a></li>
</ul>

<p class=MsoNormal><b> Projects<o:p></o:p></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal>[Note: Please provide your project demo to your TA during
lab hours and submit your project report through EEE <span class=GramE>tool ]</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal> </p>

<p class=MsoNormal><a
href="http://www.ics.uci.edu/%7Eeli/courses/cs153-f09/p1.txt">Project 1</a> –
Due Monday Oct 5, 2009</p>

<p class=MsoNormal><a
href="http://www.ics.uci.edu/%7Eeli/courses/cs153-f09/p2.txt">Project 2</a>-
Due Wednesday Oct 14<span class=GramE>,2009</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><a
href="http://www.ics.uci.edu/~eli/courses/cs153-f09/p3.txt">Project 3</a>- Due
Wednesday Oct 21, 2009</p>

<p class=MsoNormal><a
href="http://www.ics.uci.edu/~eli/courses/cs153-f09/p4.txt">Project 4</a>- Due
Monday Nov 2, 2009</p>

<p class=MsoNormal><a
href="http://www.ics.uci.edu/~eli/courses/cs153-f09/p5.txt">Project 5</a>- Due
Monday Nov 23, 2009 (Click <a
href="http://www.ics.uci.edu/~eli/courses/cs153-f09/example-seq.txt">here</a>
for examples of sequential component design and FSM in VHDL.)</p>

<p class=MsoNormal><a
href="http://www.ics.uci.edu/~eli/courses/cs153-f09/p6.txt">Project 6</a>- Due
Wednesday Dec 2, 2009</p>
